responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
    analysis: |
      The codebase uses JSON serialization/deserialization to handle sensitive data, such as credentials and authentication tokens, without proper encryption. This can lead to the exposure of sensitive information in the serialized JSON data, which may be stored or transmitted without proper protection. Attackers may be able to intercept and access this sensitive data, compromising the security of the application.
    cwe: CWE-311
    function_names:
      - JsonGenerator.generate
      - IspwRequestBean.setJsonRequest
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/JsonGenerator.java
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/IspwRequestBean.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Externally Controlled Reference to a Resource in Another Sphere
    analysis: |
      The codebase uses user-controlled input to construct URLs and paths that are used to access sensitive resources, such as ISPW assignments and releases. Attackers may be able to craft malicious input to access unauthorized resources or perform server-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks, potentially leading to the compromise of the application or the underlying system.
    cwe: CWE-610
    function_names:
      - IspwRestApiRequest.resolveUrl
      - IspwRestApiRequestStep.Execution.run
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/IspwRestApiRequest.java
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/IspwRestApiRequestStep.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
    analysis: |
      The codebase uses user-controlled input to construct OS command strings, which are then executed by the application. Attackers may be able to inject malicious commands into these inputs, potentially leading to the execution of arbitrary commands on the system, a critical security vulnerability.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names:
      - HttpClientUtil.appendParamsToUrl
      - HttpClientUtil.paramsToString
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/util/HttpClientUtil.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
    analysis: |
      The codebase uses HTTP headers and parameters to control the behavior of the application, such as authentication and authorization. Attackers may be able to forge or tamper with these headers and parameters, potentially bypassing security checks and gaining unauthorized access to the application.
    cwe: CWE-345
    function_names:
      - IspwRestApiRequest.resolveHeaders
      - IspwRestApiRequestStep.Execution.run
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/IspwRestApiRequest.java
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/IspwRestApiRequestStep.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input
    analysis: |
      The codebase uses user-controlled input to specify parameters for ISPW actions, such as assignment IDs, release IDs, and task IDs. Attackers may be able to provide malformed or out-of-range input, potentially leading to unexpected behavior or errors in the application.
    cwe: CWE-1284
    function_names:
      - IspwRestApiRequest.resolveUrl
      - IspwRestApiRequestStep.Execution.run
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/IspwRestApiRequest.java
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/IspwRestApiRequestStep.java
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not consistently handle all possible exceptions and error conditions, which can lead to unexpected behavior or crashes in the application. Attackers may be able to trigger these errors to disrupt the application's functionality or potentially gain further access to the system.
    cwe: CWE-755
    function_names:
      - HttpRequestExecution.call
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/compuware/ispw/restapi/HttpRequestExecution.java
    classification: slightly promising

```

leads.headline: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
leads.analysis: The codebase uses JSON serialization/deserialization to handle sensitive data, such as credentials and authentication tokens, without proper encryption. This can lead to the exposure of sensitive information in the serialized JSON data, which may be stored or transmitted without proper protection. Attackers may be able to intercept and access this sensitive data, compromising the security of the application.

leads.headline: Externally Controlled Reference to a Resource in Another Sphere
leads.analysis: The codebase uses user-controlled input to construct URLs and paths that are used to access sensitive resources, such as ISPW assignments and releases. Attackers may be able to craft malicious input to access unauthorized resources or perform server-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks, potentially leading to the compromise of the application or the underlying system.

leads.headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
leads.analysis: The codebase uses user-controlled input to construct OS command strings, which are then executed by the application. Attackers may be able to inject malicious commands into these inputs, potentially leading to the execution of arbitrary commands on the system, a critical security vulnerability.

leads.headline: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
leads.analysis: The codebase uses HTTP headers and parameters to control the behavior of the application, such as authentication and authorization. Attackers may be able to forge or tamper with these headers and parameters, potentially bypassing security checks and gaining unauthorized access to the application.

leads.headline: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input
leads.analysis: The codebase uses user-controlled input to specify parameters for ISPW actions, such as assignment IDs, release IDs, and task IDs. Attackers may be able to provide malformed or out-of-range input, potentially leading to unexpected behavior or errors in the application.

leads.headline: Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions
leads.analysis: The codebase does not consistently handle all possible exceptions and error conditions, which can lead to unexpected behavior or crashes in the application. Attackers may be able to trigger these errors to disrupt the application's functionality or potentially gain further access to the system.
